stream_context.summary: Kaze prototyped a new "cement pit" mechanic for the Oil-Rig level (working title “Oily Boily Bay”, Quest 11).  He also tweaked Mario’s head-bob animation, iterated on a new HUD health bar, removed the planned player-skin system in favour of a coin shop, and brainstormed construction-themed NPCs and colour fixes for a temple area.

development_findings.summary: Implemented cement-pit footprints by writing directly to a 127×63 render texture, abandoning decal spawning for performance.
development_findings.quote: If we do it this way then we don’t have a limit on the footprints either.

development_findings.summary: Solved jitter in Mario’s new fall-head animation (idea credited to ZorroOrganic) by fine-tuning parameters.
development_findings.quote: I still want to fine-tune it a bit… that looks a lot less jittery.

development_findings.summary: New HUD health bar slides from centre to corner and returns on damage; speed and final position still under review.
development_findings.quote: Whenever you take damage it comes back into the middle just to make the player aware of it.

development_findings.summary: Decided to scrap cosmetic skins and instead add a coin shop (e.g., buy a permanent double-jump/invincibility star for 100 coins).
development_findings.quote: Skins are gone. Instead maybe we’ll make it so the player can buy stuff for Mario’s house.

development_findings.summary: Temple level judged “colour vomit”; plan to shift bricks from grey to brown/gold and match sky/water before Biobak remodels.
development_findings.quote: Something about this level is just ass… maybe if the sky was more the colour of the water or the water was more the colour of the sky.

development_findings.summary: Brainstormed construction NPC set: Koopas & Goombas with hard hats, thwomps with back shields & warning signs, wiggler site-manager who reddens with player mischief.
development_findings.quote: Wiggler with a construction helmet on every one of his pieces… he’s gonna get more and more red.

development_findings.summary: Will add sliding and ground-pound variants of footprints; chose circular stamps to avoid costly per-pixel rotation code.
development_findings.quote: Rotating them is just overkill for this – we’re making them circular, it’s fine.

development_findings.summary: Considering four added minigames to bring star count to 175–180, unsure why current list shows 171.
development_findings.quote: Then again I thought we already had 180 stars; I must be missing something.

development_findings.summary: Second public demo might re-release first three levels with improvements; no larger demo planned.
development_findings.quote: It’d be fun to release a demo of the original three levels again… I’m not gonna make a banger demo than that.

context_findings.summary: Kaze tweaks difficulty after watching testers struggle; Zeina’s repeated deaths prompted softer water penalty.
context_findings.quote: When I watch the player and it’s painful to watch them, I need to make it easier… it was very painful to watch her.

context_findings.summary: Expressed disdain for PC-port graphics route; joked about remaking Mario 64 in Unreal as a prank.
context_findings.quote: If I wanted my game to be PC-only and have nicer graphics, I would just use Unreal Engine.

context_findings.summary: Frustration with Fast64 bugs and VS Code intellisense issues visible; prefers minimal tooling and hates dealing with config.
context_findings.quote: I hate dealing with tech issues, I’ll just leave it as is.

context_findings.summary: Shows playful, candid persona: dislikes coffee, Yoshi’s Island DS, and Twitch’s recent policies; enjoys ice-cream and coding all-nighters.

biobak.summary: Gave real-time feedback on HUD bar speed and temple colour palette; will remodel bricks once colours are approved.
biobak.quote: Movement is a bit slow—you could make it at least two times as fast.

zeina.summary: Play-tested oil-rig level; her difficulty motivated reduced water penalty.
Creating 8×12 pixel textures for dive and ground-pound cement stamps; concurrently animating Bowser.
zeina.quote: Do you want to make one for Mario ground-pounding like this? So just leave a stamp in there? … I can certainly try.

key_stories.title: Inventing the Cement Footprint Mechanic
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted the oil-rig’s wet cement to record Mario’s steps.  Decals proved memory-heavy, so he switched to writing low-res sprites onto a dedicated texture, debugging size, alignment, and memory corruption issues live.
key_stories.challenge: Store and display many footprints without crippling N64 performance.
key_stories.process: Tested decals → hit memory limits → pivoted to 127×63 render texture; hand-drew 4×3 sprites; solved alignment & clipping; decided on circular stamps to skip rotation math.
key_stories.outcome: Working prototype that darkens permanently, with plans to add slide and butt-stomp variants and a supervisor NPC reacting to mess.
key_stories.key_quote: This looks so good!  Wait until we rotate the feet … actually we’ll make them circular so I don’t have to deal with rotating them.

key_stories.title: Health Bar Overhaul
key_stories.summary: A new health bar animates from screen centre to corner and back on damage.  Biobak noted sluggish movement; Kaze adjusted speed and debated final placement.
key_stories.challenge: Create an eye-catching yet unobtrusive HUD element.
key_stories.process: Implemented slide animation; solicited chat and Biobak feedback; experimented with scaling and centre vs corner placement.
key_stories.outcome: Animation logic complete; fine-tuning of speed/position still open.
key_stories.key_quote: Someone said it looks a little weird … maybe we should move it into the centre—okay, no one put Mario RPG.

key_stories.title: Temple Colour Crisis
key_stories.summary: Kaze declared the temple area’s greys ‘colour vomit.’  He and Biobak tested browner brick palettes and a new water texture to achieve ‘Mario colours’ before a full remodel.
key_stories.process: Live palette swaps; considered gold/brown bricks and matching sky-water hues; shared reference textures.
key_stories.outcome: Agreed on browner bricks, desaturated yellows; Biobak to re-work geometry once colours locked.
key_stories.key_quote: Holy shit, this is so ugly… maybe like a more golden—would that take long to do?

key_stories.title: Pivot from Skins to Coin Shop
key_stories.summary: Earlier plan for unlockable skins was scrapped.  Kaze now wants coins to buy power-ups or house decorations, preserving balance while adding collectibles.
key_stories.challenge: Skins felt superfluous and resource heavy.
key_stories.process: Announced removal; brainstormed purchasable power-star granting double-jump/invincibility.
key_stories.outcome: Shop system green-lit; design details TBD.
key_stories.key_quote: Skins are gone. Instead maybe we’ll make it so the player can buy shit for Mario’s house.

key_stories.title: Designing Construction NPCs
key_stories.summary: For the oil-rig, Kaze outlined a full cast of themed enemies and hazards, deciding on safety-vest thwomps, hard-hat koopas, glass-carrying koopas to smash, and an emotion-changing wiggler foreman.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed live with chat; rejected hazmat suits; chose helmeted variants and warning-sign plates.
key_stories.outcome: Concept list finalised; modelling/animation tasks queued.
key_stories.key_quote: Thwomps with warning signs—and there has to be an overseer… I think a wiggler is perfect for that.
